items.title: WooCommerce Review: The Most Popular E-Commerce Platform
items.summary: If you want to run an online store on WordPress you have…
items.content_html:
If you want to run an online store on WordPress you have to choose WooCommerce but only when you know what WooCommerce can do and what it is. If you have a WordPress E-commerce website then WooCommerce is the heart of the WordPress e-commerce store and without WooCommerce you can’t run an online store on WordPress.

Nowadays e-commerce business owners are pretty thin these days. If they want to think anything else they don’t even have time to think between launching an online store and managing any merchandise. And for doing anything for an e-commerce website with the most popular CMS WordPress you have only some options like WooCommerce. Without WooCommerce you can’t run any online store on WordPress with any hosting or any domain.

There are a number of high-quality online store builder options for e-commerce sites. According to Builtwith, WooCommerce is the most popular and loved e-commerce platform available.

To understand the answer of why it is a most popular choice then we need to look closer at what WooCommerce actually is, how it works, and what it offers to its users.

WooCommerce History

WooCommerce was designed and created by two developers, Mike Jolley and James Koster. They worked on replication of an existing e-commerce plugin and the result was the release of WooCommerce in 2011.

WooCommerce and Woothemes were both purchased in 2015 by Automatic, the company behind WordPress. Automatic is now the current developer of WooCommerce, which is used by over 300,000 online store owners that include some large and high-traffic sites.

Users of WooCommerce like it for some reasons like it is easy to install and configure which is always a bonus for busy digital retailers.

WooCommerce: The Basics

The first thing we need to understand is how WooCommerce works on a basic level.

Basically, WooCommerce is a WordPress plugin. And it’s not a standalone site builder but it’s an open-source WordPress plugin so anyone can use this and convert their WordPress site to a WordPress e-commerce store.

First customers need to purchase a hosting services provider and next they need to install and setup WordPress. After the design with all security features with plugins, the user needs to install and setup WooCommerce to handle the e-commerce functions of the site. In the other words, WooCommerce only works as a builder for the e-commerce feature of the site.

It’s versatile but you can build with it is impressive as it works for both physical and digital goods. You can also sell products with multiple variants and features and also offer instant access via download for digital items or downloadable items. You can even use WooCommerce with an affiliate marketing model.

Free to Use: But you want Paid Add-ons

Currently, woocommerce available for free but for additional features and functionality with flexibility users need to purchase some more extensions.

However, as an online store expands, those extensions and plugins are important to give your customers the best e-commerce experience.

In addition to the market of extensions, anyone can purchase built-in or WooCommerce compatible/pre-enabled themes with WooThemes at low cost than the market full of premium WordPress themes for e-commerce. And WooThemes can give you true e-commerce online store experience.

With all these functionalities, you can rival any of the major players of e-commerce platforms.

How to Configure WooCommerce?

After activation of the plugin, the plugin needs to configure for your products.

If you are well known for WordPress and how its dashboard then setting up WooCommerce can be easier for you.

You will get a new menu into your sidebar from where you can set up everything you need for your e-commerce website like adding products, setting store information, payment gateway, etc. Adding new products is also as simple as you add new posts for your WordPress website.

Creating a new product-

  1. Navigate to the WooCommerce option in the sidebar of the WordPress dashboard.
  2. Add new product
  3. Create Title and description
  4. Add product images
  5. Add pricing details
  6. And then publish it after adding inventory details in the inventory tab.

Add Upsells and Cross-Sells

You can add upsells and cross-sells too for free.

WooCommerce offers users to control how their store will be displayed and to shape the customer’s experience while they are shopping on your store.

Sitebuilders tools and Templates

WooCommerce is not a site builder itself but Shopify can let you design an e-commerce website for you where you need to pay for every feature even for hosting it. Here, WooCommerce can let you design your online store for your customers.

What is WooCommerce Storefront?

WooCommerce itself offers a storefront, generally, a free WordPress theme can be designed to integrate the core WooCommerce plugin, maximize speed and site performance with eliminating theme/plugins conflicts.

You can choose and install a storefront child theme to refine the appearance of your e-commerce site.

Features: Speed, SEO, Support

Depends on the theme used by you, mostly all themes come with SEO Optimized to make sure your customers can find your site online. These WordPress themes are designed for WooCommerce e-commerce sites and mostly are optimized for mobile users as well.

When you purchase a theme on the official WordPress website you can also access their support forum. Some of the themes come with detailed documents like how to set up their theme features and installation process.

There are also WordPress themes available from a third party like ThemeForest which can avail you thousands of e-commerce themes for your website which are compatible with WooCommerce as well and all are mobile responsive and optimized.

Here are some quick or detailed features and settings available for the WooCommerce website in settings:

Features and Setting of WooCommerce

100+ Payment Options

There are almost 100+ payemnt options available in WooCommerce plugin that include major credit cards, paypal, bank transfers and even cash on delivery. I fyou need more felixible payment gateway you can use over 100 payment gateway integrations that are also available including Stripe, Amazon Payments, and more.

Proper Collections of Applicable Taxes

There is One big area of concern for e-commerce site owners is the proper collection of applicable taxes.

WooCommerce gives the owners a great deal of control over how this is implemented and configure settings so that tax is calculated on the shipping address, billing address, or your store location.

WooCommerce lets you select whether you want to display product prices inclusive of tax in your country, meaning that all product prices will include the tax price in your region.

Offer Discounts and Coupons

WooCommerce also allows some impressive coupons for offers and discounts. In addition to products and types of products usage, you can restrict coupons to use with a minimum amount or minimum product quantity and also you can restrict coupons for conflicting with other coupons and even you can ban individual email addresses from usage of that coupons.

Automate Customer Follow ups

You can customize and tweak all the emails your customers receive in the process of purchasing on your site in the Emails menu.

WooCommerce Extensions and Plugins

The settings mentioned above are what you get with the basic plugin. You can extend your functionality by selecting and installing the right extensions from WooCommerce’s extensions store.

You can select from over 400 official extensions.

You can find plugins for almost any features designed to improve the appearance of your site, even you can increase conversions by analyzing customer behavior on your site.

Free and premium WooCommerce extensions and additional plugins let you add features like:

  1. Appointment bookings
  2. Membership-only sections of your site
  3. Recurring subscriptions for digital or physical goods
  4. Shipment tracking
  5. Bulk discounts
  6. Accept payments in-person via Square
  7. Generate store credit coupons
  8. Offer gift certificates
  9. Subscriptions gifting
  10. Manage ticket sales for events
  11. Manage and track EU VAT rules.

Some WooCommerce Plugins Recommended that can help you to get more functionality for your store:

  1. One Page Checkout
  2. WooCommerce Follow-ups
  3. MailChimp
  4. Conversio
  5. Beeketing
  6. WooCommerce Social Login
  7. WooCommerce Multilingual
  8. Product Add-Ons
  9. Smart Coupons
  10. WooCommerce Points and Rewards
  11. WooCommerce Product Table
  12. WooCommerce Product Search
  13. WooCommerce Dropshipping

Migrating to WooCommerce From Shopify

If you’re currently using Shopify ecommerce store, some hosts will help you migrate your site.

Cart2Cart: Export Your Shopify Store to WooCommerce

You can also use a shopify app Cart2Cart. With Cart2Cart you can export the entire Shopify Store to WooCommerce including your products and customer orders.

Cart2Cart offers two ways to complete migration.

You can either follow the step-by-step instructions in their set-up wizard or,

  1. They can finish the process for you.
  2. And you don’t have to be concerned about how the migration will impact your store.

How to Install WooCommerce?

  1. First, log in to your WordPress site.
  2. Then go to Plugins > Add New.
  3. Search for “WooCommerce”
  4. Select Install Now
  5. Select Activate Now

Then you are ready to use the WooCommerce wizard.

items.title: Top 5 Best Hosting Providers For Drupal
items.summary: Drupal- not much popular as WordPress, but it’s just capable of creating…
items.content_html:
Drupal- not much popular as WordPress, but it’s just capable of creating a secure website for your business. If you are looking to publish much amount of content or want to sell products then Drupal can be a sensible choice for CMS (Content Management System).

What is Drupal?

Drupal ranks 3rd in the list of most popular CMSs, with WordPress and Joomla, holds the top two spots. Its market share is 4.8% with more than 577,00+ active sites. It may not be easy to learn for users. It requires basic knowledge of PHP and web development, so it is not as user-friendly as WordPress.

Best Web Hosting Platform for Drupal

If you want to run Drupal, it’s important to choose the right web host that offers Drupal optimization. If you are new to Drupal or assistance then I will help you to find out better web host for Drupal.

So Why Drupal Specific Hosting Companies?

You need Some specific features:

Best Server Infrastructure

They can be able to provide a server infrastructure that is optimized for running Drupal websites in a way.

Better Speed

They should provide the feature to help Drupal run faster. Like you can use caching tools.

Better Support

They can provide the best hosting support so that they can understand the complete Drupal features and their errors.

Best Security and Compatibility

Hosting should have a better Drupal Community and be able to provide security notifications, even they should have to provide notifications for server upgrades to handle in upcoming Drupal versions.

Top Drupal Specific Hostings

These Drupal hosting companies are the biggest hosting providers for Drupal. They may be expensive but they offer best services for Drupal for running your Drupal website smoothly. They also offer lots of extra tools and features that can help you to manage and deploy your Drupal websites.

These are the things common in all these hosting services:

  1. They were all founded by Drupal users, including one by the founder of Drupal himself.

What is Magento?

There is one advantage of Magento that is insanely flexible and scalable. You can start with a small store and build it into a billion-dollar business without changing your platforms.

Do you know if you are running a Magento store with poor hosting is something like having a new Lambo with an old engine?

Unfortunately, for all its features Magento is a resource. That’s the reality of things. Only a top-level hosting provider will make this platform work better for your business.

In these below reviews, you can find out the info about the best hostings for Magento. Keep reading.

Scala Hosting provides automated Magento Updates but sometimes things are broken during the updates. So you should not opt-in for automatic updates.

items.title: Top 10 Best Joomla Hosting Providers in 2020
items.summary: Joomla is one of the most popular and secure CMS and there…
items.content_html:
Joomla is one of the most popular and secure CMS and there are quite a few hosts that support it. However, selecting the best Joomla hosts can be the biggest challenge for you. Many people love Joomla, but nobody wants to spend a couple of months shifting through bad web hosting providers.

For just save your time and money, we have analyzed a list of providers that claim to have a great platform for Joomla. So keep reading to find out which hosts can be better for you to host your Joomla website on it and which you should avoid.

Before starting the review and detail for every hosting we want to let you know about how we have evaluated the best Joomla Hosts:

Here are the steps we have followed for choosing our Joomla Hosting:

  1. Check reputation
  2. Go through the terms of service
  3. Check out hosting features
  4. Set up a Joomla website
  5. Test the support
  6. Check user reviews

So, Let’s begin with our list of best Joomla Website Hosting Providers:

Cloudways

Cloudways is a managed cloud services provider in terms of web hosting for PHP-Based CMSs like WordPress and Joomla.

Cloudways Performance

Cloudways performance is very hard to test. Cloudways lets you host apps on top public cloud providers like AWS, Digital Ocean, Google Cloud, Vultr, etc. Meanwhile, Cloudways offers professional management for Cloud servers. It’s extremely fast and high uptime. For e.g., Netflix hosted on AWS, and did you heard anything about Netflix was down or speed issues in Netflix? The answer is No.

This managed Joomla hosting adds PHP 7 support, Cloudflare CDN, and Memcached, Varnish, and Redis caching mechanisms. This lets you get excellent load times with some extra optimization.

Customer Support in Cloudways

Cloudways offers a solid support team that is available 24/7 for you with virtual servers. Their tech support takes care of various things like virtual machine management, backups, and server maintenance. You can contact them anytime if something is not working properly or if you need something like learning materials.

You can also get any application-level support for Joomla. Their support team can help you in troubleshooting themes and plugins and optimize the CMS Performance for you.

Cloudways Features

This hosting runs a smooth management panel. This enables you the things like SSL Installation, server scaling options, and automated backups. You can also setup a custom backup schedule.

You will also get a ton of other security features. This includes a specially configured firewall, auto-healing servers, IP Whitelisting, and more.

Cloudways lets you scale server resources up or down on the go. You have to pay for the resources by the hour, so you can always get the exact allocation you need.

These features make Cloudways one of the best Joomla hosts if you’re unsure how much resources you’ll need.

Cloudways is an excellent solution with unique advantages. You can get a flexible platform for your Joomla site.

Cloudways Pricing

Pros of Cloudways

  • Runs on excellent cloud infrastructures
  • Insane scalability and reliability
  • Excellent support
  • Optimized server stack
  • Pay-as-you-go pricing

Cons of Cloudways

  • Pricy for starting out
  • The proprietary CDN is paid extra

BlueHost

Bluehost is one of the popular web hosting service provider for CMSs. There is no way around it. It works for over 80 platforms which include Joomla too.

Performance of BlueHost

Bluehost has a 99.9% uptime guarantee. Most providers also offer this, so it’s easy to see the source of the mix-up.

While Bluehost says it resolves most downtime issues within 15 minutes, it offers no guarantee. This is strange as most of their competitors offer at least small compensation for excessive downtime.

Not to worry, though. Bluehost’s actual uptime falls around 99.95%. Bluehost doesn’t tailor speed optimization tools specifically to Joomla web hosting. However, its configuration makes Joomla run fast even without speed optimization tools.

Customer Support of BlueHost

Bluehost support team feel personal despite servicing over a million users. Their agents take their time to review your issues and to give you the best possible answer.

Bluehost has many CMS experts in its support team. They have many experts that understand Joomla better and are available to help users with any technical issues.

Unfortunately, the knowledge base offers a few Joomla guides. Instead, Bluehost always points you to Joomla.org for documentation. You can get some general Joomla help there.

Features of BlueHost

In BlueHost, you will get a one-click installer for Joomla with speed optimization and security. Joomla server stack also optimized for the best performance.

BlueHost also offers some very advanced account access features. It can be very helpful when you need multiple users to access the admin panel which is important for larger Joomla websites.

Some basic features you will get:

  1. 50 GB SSD Storage
  2. Unmetered Bandwidth
  3. Free SSL Certificate
  4. Standard Performance
  5. FREE Domain for 1 Year
  6. Automatic Daily Malware Scan
  7. Free Google Adwords credits

BlueHost Pricing

Pros of BlueHost

  • Lightning-fast platform
  • Awesome features

Cons of BlueHost

  • Costly website migrations
  • No Joomla guides in the knowledge base

SiteGround

SiteGround used to be Joomla’s demo hosting provider—meaning you could get a free Joomla site from it. Although this isn’t the case anymore, the hosting provider is still an avid Joomla supporter and one of its top contributors.

Here’s how its plans benefit Joomla users.

Performance of SiteGround

SiteGround offers a 99.9% Uptime guarantee, and if they can’t provide 99.9% uptime then they will offer you a month of free hosting.

Their infrastructure delivers 99.99% uptime. You can also expect a few minutes of downtime per month.

SiteGround is the fastest web server and their server response time is under 0.2 seconds this year. Their server stack is optimized for Joomla, so you can get impressive server response time and loading speed as well.

In terms of Overall performance, SiteGround is among the best Joomla Hosts.

Customer Support of SiteGround

The customer support of SiteGround is a highlight of this hosting which is available 24/7 and responds to all queries immediately. They offer live chat support in which waiting time doesn’t more than 10 minutes and it’s only for some time not always and also you can also call them via phone.

SiteGround also has a number of Joomla articles in its knowledge base.

Features of SiteGround

You will get all the basic features like SSD Storage, an SSL Certificate, Security features, and a control panel.

SiteGround leads to impressive performance. It provides a custom Joomla Caching solution. Their other custom solution is the jHackGuard Joomla extension which provides an additional layer of security against SQL Injection, remote code executions, and XSS-Based attacks.

If you want to use Joomla for e-commerce then go with the biggest plan. And in that plan, you will get the advantage of the PCI-Complaint server and all additional speed with security features.

Some Basic features include:

  1. Unmetered Traffic
  2. Free SSL
  3. Daily Backup
  4. Free CDN
  5. Free Email
  6. Unlimited Databases
  7. 100% renewable energy match
  8. 30-Days Money-Back

SiteGround Pricing

Pros of SiteGround

  • Top-notch support
  • Excellent Joomla-specific features
  • Top performance
  • eCommerce-ready

Cons of SiteGround

  • Somewhat limited starter plan

A2 Hosting

A2 Hosting services provide speed and performance. It’s also a Joomla sponsor and offers hosting for it.

Performance of A2 Hosting

A2 Hosting provides guarantee of 99.9% uptime and the actual uptime stays above 99.99% which is almost perfect.

Average response time is 0.54 seconds, the basic page load time is 1.15 seconds. This seems to be reasonable but a few of the best Joomla hosting providers are faster.

Customer Support of A2 Hosting

Their customer support is awesome. They are available 24/7, and customer support agents are much knowledgeable about CMS Hosting. They are basically prefer solving your issues themselves rather than answering your questions. They have much experience of Joomla and they can quickly resolve your easy to difficult queries.

Features of A2 Hosting

  1. Unlimited SSD Space & Transfer
  2. Free & Easy Site Migration
  3. Free Automatic Backups
  4. Easy Money Back Guarantee
  5. 99.9% Uptime Commitment
  6. 24/7/365 Guru Crew Support
  7. Free SSL Certificate

A2 Hosting Pricing

Pros of A2 Hosting

  • Top performance
  • Effective support team

Cons of A2 Hosting

  • Few Joomla features

DreamHost

DreamHost has a commitment to the open source community, so all of their hosting services are built with open source. Joomla, as a leading open source application, thus is well supported by this web host.

Performance of DreamHost

DreamHost guarantees 100% server uptime which excludes the scheduled maintenance. If your email, webmail, SSH, FTP or database is not working just due to failure of the server or network then you can ask them for a credit of 1-day hosting fee for each hour of downtime.

Customer Support of DreamHost

DreamHost offers technical support in various means. If you have some urgent issues then you can start online chat from your control panel or you can also submit support ticket and they usually responds within 2 hours.

Features of DreamHost

  1. SSL secured server and SSH access
  2. Perl, Python, Ruby, SSI and CGI
  3. IPv6 support
  4. The access to log files
  5. Fast SSD Storage
  6. Free SSL Certificate
  7. Add Email as low as $1.67/mo
  8. Free Domain

DreamHost Pricing

Pros of DreamHost

  • Monthly billing available
  • Good Loading speed
  • Average Uptime
  • Free SSL

Cons of DreamHost

  • Too Costly
  • Email accounts are not free
  • Renewal cost also high
  • No option to choose data centers outside the USA.
  • Limited Live Chat option

InMotion

InMotion hosting is one of the most popular and leading independent hosting providers.

Due to this, InMotion gets better each month with the time being, while many other providers are stuck at the same position.

Performance of InMotion

InMotion Hosting provides a 99.9% uptime. InMotion Hosted websites speed depends upon the location of your audience. InMotion Hosting has their two servers in the U.S and you can host your Joomla website for your US audience and deliver your content quickly. They have a product which is Max Speed Zones which can reduce latency issues, but this also gets mixed results. Their server response time is also better which results in decreasing loading time of any website.

Customer Support of InMotion

You can contact their support from live chat and Skype also. Experts on the support team of InMotion are much knowledgeable about Joomla and want to help with your website anytime. They also offer a knowledge base which is also with various Joomla articles.

Features of InMotion

Basic features you will get in all of their plans:

  1. Easy Google Apps Integration
  2. One-Click Installs of 400+ Applications
  3. Free No-Downtime Website Migration
  4. Free Website Builder
  5. WP-CLI Enabled
  6. Money-Back Guarantee

Cons of InMotion

Hostinger

Hostinger is one of the popular hosting service provider and it also provides free hosting for a year with their copyright at the bottom for various CMSs. Their hosting services are also much popular for their cheap plans and discounts.

Performance of Hostinger

Hostinger’s uptime is always above 9.9% which is better. This hosting offers the standard 99.9% uptime guarantee and refunds 5% of your hosting fee if it fails to provide that much uptime which is trustable.

Hostinger’s speed is impressive. This provider scored a responsive time of 0.19 seconds and required speed for loading a page is 0.68 seconds.

Speed of any website falls when your website has high traffic but this hosting doesn't slow down your website much.

Customer Support of Hostinger

  7. Unlimited Email accounts
  8. Unlimited Email forwarding accounts
  9. Unlimited Email autoresponders
  10. Email aliases
  11. Email virus scanning
  12. Business-grade email available
  13. Free Let's Encrypt SSL
  14. Enhanced SSL certs
  15. 24/7 FTP access
  16. phpMyAdmin
  17. Softaculous script installer

HostPapa Pricing

Pros of HostPapa

  • Performs well
  • Attentive support
  • Excellent ecommerce features
  • Great for beginners

Cons of HostPapa

  • Automated backups are a paid feature
  • Unclear uptime guarantee

Closing Words

When you are going to select any hosting for your Joomla website then you should check about the uptime, storage, security, speed and user reviews and if you have found best hosting then you can select one but there is no guarantee you will get overall best hosting as every feature may vary from one another.

items.title: Top 10 Best WordPress Hosting Services in 2020
items.summary: Are you looking for best web hosting for your WordPress site? Here…
items.content_html:
Are you looking for best web hosting for your WordPress site? Here in this article we will help you to choose a better web host for your website.

We all know choosing the right hosting for your WordPress website is much important for your rankings and speed also. Your WordPress site’s health always relies on the hosting provider you use for your website.

But how you can choose a better WordPress host?

There are many web hosting providers to choose from like Bluehost, SiteGround, HostGator..etc.

There are three very important factors for WordPress hosting:

  • Speed: Load Time
  • Uptime: Uptime of any website server should be at least 99% because of the ranking of any WordPress website.
  • Customer Support: Customer support should answer your questions related to your WordPress website.

Usually, we can’t guarantee you will get similar uptime or speed for your website as this varies on different factors like your chosen hosting plan, your website size, and the number of visitors coming to your website.

Let’s start with the best hosting providers first then we will move down to the list to see which one you have to avoid or choose. Here are the top 10 web hostings for WordPress:

1. Bluehost (www.bluehost.com) 

  • Uptime: 99.98%
  • Load time: 553 ms
  • Support: 24/7 live chat, knowledge base, phone
  • Features: One-click install for WordPress, free SSL, free domain for 1 year
  • Website: www.Bluehost.com

Bluehost is a very popular hosting service among many small business owners and bloggers who use WordPress for their website. The simple reason is- they have cheap prices starting from $2.75/month and it’s simple to use like one-click WordPress installation option and they usually don’t have any performance issues.

Also as we have used it for our WordPress websites and we have seen that this is the best cost/value ratio. Our uptime and speed monitoring tool Pingdom showed us an average uptime of our website is 99.98% and an average page loading speed of 554 ms for the last 10-months.

They are also one of the few web hosts that are officially being recommended by WordPress.org. As all of their plans come with free SSL, a WordPress staging environment and a very easy WordPress install feature.

And also Bluehost doesn’t offer a free site migration service with its lowest plan and it will cost you about $500 for transferring anyone site. If you will purchase their plus plan or above then you will get this feature for free for one website.

Bluehost has a very large database for WordPress tutorials and all plans come with 24/7 live support which is very fast and reliable.

Bluehost Pricing

Pricing of Bluehost starts at $2.75/month (with 3 years plan) and they provide a free domain with SSL for a year. Their renewal price is $7.99/month. Bluehost also comes with a one-month money-back guarantee.

Pros of Bluehost:

Strong uptime and load time, free custom domain name and recommended by WordPress.org.

Cons of Bluehost:

No option to pay monthly, no free migration for a website with the lowest plan.

2. HostGator Managed WordPress (www.HostGator.com)

  • Uptime: 99.97%
  • Load time: 284 ms
  • Support: 24/7 live chat, knowledge base, phone
  • Features: Free site transfer and backups. WordPress optimized servers, unlimited bandwidth
  • Website: www.HostGator.com

HostGator hosts almost 15 million domains over the world making them one of the most popular web hosting service providers on the market. Similarly the Bluehost, HostGator also offers WordPress hosting solutions.

HostGator was the best option for high traffic websites which needs to be good at loading speed. HostGator WordPress plan can also make your website faster across different regions and for mobile users.

All of their plans have unlimited bandwidth, storage, free email accounts, and a free site migration feature.

You can also reach their support any time via phone or live chat and believe us their customer support is very helpful and fast.

HostGator Pricing

Their pricing starting from $5.97/month if you will go with 3 years plan and their renewal price are higher at $9.95/month. Even HostGator offers a 45 days money-back guarantee.

Pros of HostGator

The good Loading speed of the websites, reliable and one-click install WordPress with 1 free site migration option.

Cons of HostGator:

Its renewal price is very high.

3. Hostinger (www.Hostinger.com)

  • Uptime: 99.96%
  • Load time: 308 ms
  • Support: 24/7 live chat, knowledge base
  • Features: Free email account, unlimited bandwidth, free SSL
  • Website: www.Hostinger.com

Hostinger is the hosting service provider from Europe but has data centers in the USA, Asia, and Europe. They don’t have any option to choose the data center but once you are signed up you can ask them to change your data centers from the USA to Asia or Europe.

They also have a WordPress builder which is not very ideal but it can help in the beginning a lot. Hostinger also offers 24/7 live chat support which is very helpful and they also have the largest library of WordPress guides.

Hostinger Pricing

Their pricing for WordPress starts from $2.15/Month if you choose 4 years time period and it will renew at $3.49/Month. This plan also includes unlimited bandwidth and 20GB disc space with 1 email account as well as an SSL Certificate and free site migration option.

And also they will provide you 30 days refund guarantee from the signup if you are not satisfied with their services.

Pros of Hostinger

  • Cheap Price
  • One-Click WordPress install
  • Fast Speed
  • Free Site Migration

Cons of Hostinger

  • Average Uptime
  • Very Limited Disc Space for all of their plan.

4. SiteGround (www.siteground.com)

  • Uptime: 99.99%
  • Load time: 643 ms
  • Support: 24/7 live chat
  • Features: Google cloud servers, free https (SSL), free email, free site migration
  • Website: www.SiteGround.com 

SiteGround is also the most popular WordPress hosting service provider and recommended by Wordpress.org itself. From 2004, SiteGround started and growing as a large network of about 800,000 domain names and hosts those around the world.

They are in the list of few hosts who provide you an option to change your data center locations from Europe to the USA, the USA to Europe. So if your visitors are mainly from the USA only it’s a better option for you.

Also, they offer WordPress site migration for free which also includes a free CDN and image optimization service which makes your WordPress website faster than before.

Their Customer support was also very friendly and helpful and they answer your questions too quickly with very less waiting time to connect with their support via live chat and you can also call them directly but waiting time in call support is longer than live chat support and you will get a good experience with their support team.

SiteGround Pricing

In terms of pricing, SiteGround is expensive. Their pricing starts from $6.99/month with a 12-month plan but it renews at $14.99/month without any free domain but they offer free email accounts.

Additionally, they offer a 1-month money-back guarantee.

Pros of SiteGround

  • Good Uptime
  • Free Site Migration
  • Fast Speed
  • Recommended by Woocommerce and WordPress.org
  • Free SSL

Cons of SiteGround

  • High Prices without any free domain

5. A2 Hosting (www.A2Hosting.com)

  • Uptime: 99.98%
  • Load time: 303 ms
  • Support: 24/7 live chat, phone, knowledge base, phone
  • Features: Fast servers, free SSL, free CDN, unlimited bandwidth
  • Website: www.A2Hosting.com

A2 Hosting is another low budget WordPress hosting. All of their plans come with SSL (Let’s Encrypt), free Cloudflare CDN, and unlimited bandwidth, and 100GB SSD Storage. Same like Siteground, you can also get to change data center locations when you want. They currently offer data centers in the USA, Netherland, and Singapore.

But as much as their services better their Customer support isn’t that much ideal it can take up to 8 minutes to connect and available 24/7. In addition, to live chat, you can also connect with them via phone too.

Also,

According to performance tests, A2 Hosting was 2nd most fastest shared WordPress hosting provider at 303 ms. A2 Hosting’s average uptime has been 99.98% with 2 hours of downtime per year.

A2 Hosting Pricing

Their pricing starts from $2.99/month for minimum registration of 3 years and it will be renewed at $8.99/month. You can also get free unlimited email accounts and website migrations and 100GB of disc space. If you own many WordPress websites then A2 Hosting was the better convenient host for you.

One plus point is A2 Offers any time money-back guarantee.

Pros of A2 Hosting

  • Fast hosting for WordPress.
  • Optimized servers for WordPress
  • Free Site Migration
  • Anytime Money back guarantee.

Cons of A2 Hosting

Renewal prices are too high.

6. GreenGeeks (www.GreenGeeks.com)

  • Uptime: 99.95%
  • Load time: 434 ms
  • Support: 24/7 live chat, phone, knowledge base
  • Features: Unlimited storage & bandwidth, automatic updates, free SSL
  • Website: www.GreenGeeks.com

If you are looking for fast, secure, and scalable Web Hosting Providers for WordPress then GreenGeeks is suitable for you. Their name itself means that they have been implementing any environment-friendly approach to hosting websites.

All of the plans of GreenGeeks include free SSL, free CDN, unlimited email accounts, unlimited bandwidth, free WordPress site transfer, and unlimited storage. They offer three data centers which are the USA, Europe, and Canada. And when you sign up, you have an option to choose your data center or server location.

If we look for support from GreenGeeks, then they provide support from Live Chat, email, and phone support as well as WordPress related tutorials and guides.

In terms of performance, they are providing a speed of 434ms which is good, and reliable uptime of 99.95%.

GreenGeeks Pricing

Their plans start from $2.95/month which renews at $9.95/month. They provide a 30-days money-back guarantee but if you have taken a free domain offer then they will deduct $13.95 for a domain name registration fee.

Pros of GreenGeeks

  • Good speed
  • Green hosting provider
  • Free SSL
  • Free site migration

Cons of GreenGeeks

  • High Renewal Cost

7. InMotion (www.InMotionHosting.com)

  • Uptime: 99.92%
  • Load time: 598 ms
  • Support: 24/7 live chat, phone, knowledge base
  • Features: WordPress is pre-installed, unlimited bandwidth, unlimited email accounts
  • Website: www.InMotionHosting.com

InMotion hosting is also the most popular WordPress hosting service provider which is US-based and with more than 350,000 domain names over the world.

There are many reasons which make InMotion a good fit for WordPress users. Every plan comes with free SSL, CDN, unlimited email accounts, and more than 200 free WordPress themes. They provide a limited number of sites to be hosted and disk space for all of those.

They provide fast and reliable 24/7 live chat and phone support based in the US. In addition to these, free WordPress transfer and they have their own BoldGrid pre-installed website builder which makes you build your website itself.

Uptime and speed of InMotion Hosting are average, but enough. They have 99.92% uptime and an average speed of 598 ms for the last 12 months as we have noticed.

InMotion Pricing

They have various WordPress plans which start from $4.99/month with a 3-year contract and it renews at $7.99/month that may vary from websites, storage, and bandwidth. They also provide dedicated WordPress solutions. Also, they offer a 90- days money-back guarantee.

Pros of InMotion

  • Reliable
  • Fast
  • Good customer support

Cons of InMotion

  • No instant activation for people outside the US.
  • Uptime is average.

8. Site5 (www.Site5.com)

  • Uptime: 99.99%
  • Load time: 556 ms
  • Support: 24/7 live chat, email, knowledge base
  • Features: free site transfer, One-click install for WordPress, unlimited disk space, and bandwidth.
  • Website: www.Site5.com

Site5 is not that much cheaper shared WordPress hosting provider but they claim to be the best option for developers as they offer a flexible control panel, good customer support, and stable hosting.

Similarly to others, Site5 also offers free Cloudflare CDN, 27/7 live chat support and site transfers. They provide 99.9% uptime guarantee. But you can’t choose data centers and default server location is set to the USA (Central).

It is not as fast as Hostinger or A2 Hosting but beats in uptime.

Site5 Pricing

Site5 is also expensive like Siteground. Their plans cost starting from $6.95/month for 2 years and it renews at a higher cost of $8.95/month. Site5 comes with a 45-days money-back guarantee.

Pros of Site5

  • Great Uptime
  • Average Speed

Cons of Site5

  • High cost
  • No-option to choose data centers

9. DreamHost (www.DreamHost.com)

  • Uptime: 99.63%
  • Load time: 894 ms
  • Support: knowledge base, limited live chat
  • Features: WordPress is pre-installed, drag and drop builder, unlimited bandwidth/storage
  • Website: www.DreamHost.com

As much we know DreamHost is a very popular and well established hosting service provider from the USA with over 340,000 customers. Just like Bluehost and Siteground, they are also recommended by WordPress.org.

Their Goal is so simple which is - to be fast, reliable, and optimized for WordPress users.

All of their plans (Shared WordPress, Managed WordPress, and VPS) offer free WordPress website builder, free SSL and SSD Storage and Unlimited Bandwidth so your website can’t be slowed down when your visitors increase to your website.

They don't offer free site transfers, it costs $99 but they provide this for free when you select a plan of $16.95/month and they also do not offer a 24/7 support option. They have live chat support, but it is only available from 5:30AM to 9:30 PM Pacific time but at least it's 7 days a week.

They are also not an ideal host for a website that servers visitors outside the USA or Asia. And their uptime is only 99.63% with an page loading speed of 894 ms. You can’t select server locations outside the USA.

DreamHost Pricing

Their plans start from $2.59/month with 3-year commitment or $4.95/month. DreamHost also has high performance managed WordPress hosting plans which are more expensive than others which costs $16.95/month. Their email accounts cost $19.99/year and free domain for a year which also renews at $15.99/year. DreamHosts gives a 97-days money-back guarantee.

Pros of DreamHost

  • Monthly billing available
  • Good Loading speed
  • Average Uptime
  • Free SSL
  • Free WordPress website builder

Cons of DreamHost

  • Too Costly
  • Email accounts are not free
  • Renewal cost also high
  • No option to choose data centers outside the USA.
  • Limited Live Chat option

10. iPage (www.iPage.com)

  • Uptime: 99.80%
  • Load time: 799 ms
  • Support: 24/7 live chat, phone, knowledge base
  • Features: Free domain, unlimited storage & bandwidth, free SSL
  • Website: www.iPage.com

iPage has basically two WordPress plans. Both plans offer a free domain name for 1 year with one-click install as well as a free SSL Certificate. Their main focus is to provide the best experience from registration to customer support. And all of the plans had both unlimited bandwidth and unlimited storage.

iPage doesn’t provide any CDN, you can’t change data centers, you have to use the default datacenter which is the USA only and there are no free site transfers too.

They also offer live chat support and phone support for 24/7 and also there is a knowledge base.

They provide uptime of 99.8% and loading time of 799 ms which are not good as most of the other WordPress web hosts above and their performance is lacking.

iPage Pricing

Their plans cost starting from $3.75/month for 1-3 years. Monthly and yearly pack renews at $9.49/month, a 2 years plan renews at $8.49/month and a 3 year plan renews at $7.49/month. Their backups cost $1/month and email accounts are only through Google suite $6 per month. They also offer a 30-days money-back guarantee for all of their plans.

Pros of iPage

  • Features are good.
  • FREE domain name
  • Best apps on the web
  • 30-day money back
  • FREE website builder
  • Analytics
  • FREE ad credits

Cons of iPage

  • No option to change data centers
  • Very average speed and uptime
  • No free site migration

WordPress Hosting Summary

We have provided a detailed review of the top 10 wordpress hosting providers. Our each review was based on speed, uptime and costs which we have checked ourselves on a test website by testing it on pingdom which is used to monitor and analyze performance.

We recommend using a web hosting provider that provides you an uptime of minimum 99.94% and loading time lesser than 700 ms.

items.content_html:
As we all know both Thrive Architect and Elementor are the most popular WordPress website and page builder plugins.

Let me be honest, I have used Thrive Architect for a quite a long time and I really love this plugin. But I have also known about the Elementor and it looked nice too for use. In fact, it had almost every feature similar to Thrive Architect. So I have tried Elementor too and I have seen that Elementor also being very similar to Thrive Architect and almost to its visual interface which looks easy to use after using Thrive Architect.

Almost dozens of page builders are available for WordPress but only two of them truly provide a distraction-free feature, experience with zero tech skills and imagination are Elementor Pro and Thrive Architect.

They are same? No, Not at all. While building your pages with both of them you will feel like flying in first class, the purpose of these editors are different.

Let me help you to find out the right one for your goals.

Comparison of Pricing Between Elementor and Thrive Architect

As we all know Elementor has a free version also so we are comparing prices of Elementor Pro and Thrive Architect.

For better comparison with Thrive Architect, we have taken Elementor Pro because it has more and better features than the free version of Elementor.

After looking above, Elementor Pro seems to be a cheaper option but there is just one important difference between both are: Thrive Architect offers lifetime unlimited updates but Elementor Pro doesn’t do the same which makes a major difference.

So if you can’t install the important updates for any plugin then it can stop being compatible with the other plugins used by you and also for your WordPress.

Also if you want updates from Elementor after the subscription period you need to purchase it again. And for Thrive Architect, you only have to purchase it once and you will get regular updates for a lifetime and you can build your websites with it as long as you want.

The Elementor landing page templates can be used as page content templates which is responsive when you will build an about page or a homepage. In thrive architect, this feature is not released yet.

The most basic elements like text, image, columns, and buttons can be found in both plugins but other elements make clear that Thrive Architect and Elementor Pro can not be used for the same purposes.

Elementor offers many elements for portfolio and online presence like image gallery, portfolio, social media likes, and embed links.

On the other hand, Thrive Architect mainly focuses more on building a true conversion-optimized website. It is an ultimate tool for online marketing, especially for sales and lead generation.

You will also get elements like evergreen countdown timers for limited time offers, star rating and table product reviews, table of content, social share, and pricing table all these can help you in building conversion optimized pages faster and in an easier way.

Thrive Architect provides a pre-designed template for every step for your sales funnel who visited first to your website will become your satisfied client. The primary goal of the template is to increase your conversion rate.

But Elementor offers less conversion-focused templates than Thrive Architect.

In thrive Architect, you can convert any of your pages in a conversion-optimized landing page without leaving your front-end editor and your page automatically turns into the correct size but in Elementor, you need to go back to the WordPress backend editor and change your page template to Elementor Canvas to build your landing page.

Comparison of Flexibility Between Elementor and Thrive Architect

The flexibility of Thrive Architect

In Thrive Architect, there are no surprises like what you see is what you get. When you start editing an element, there are no windows opening on the top of each other. You can save every setting and change in the sidebar menu.

You can customize every element with sliders, by applying the exact color, shape, size, font, space, and width of the columns.

The flexibility of Elementor Pro

Similarly, Elementor Pro having the same editing happens in the sidebar menu which makes sure you can’t be distracted while you are editing. Text can be edited inline or in the sidebar menu and also the WordPress text editor. But you can’t select only a piece of text to modify it.

Now, you have learned about which one has what features and which one is better than another.

Conclusion

Are you afraid about which one to choose or which one not to choose?

See the Final Conclusion about both after that you can get to know which one you should choose and which one is better for you.

Elementor Pro

There is no doubt in building beautifully designed and customizable pages for your WordPress website with Elementor Pro. Most of the changes can be applied within seconds.

If you will work more then you can build anything you want on your landing page and the main focus of page templates and elements is online presence and building a profile for yourself or for your business.

And if this is your main goal then you can get your clients and leads easily and you can choose Elementor Pro.

Thrive Architect

Similarly, there is no doubt in Thrive Architect which is made for successful marketing, the elements and templates are well-designed. With this, you can make sure your pages will be more conversion optimized and focused to convert your visitors into your subscribers.

The main goal of Thrive Architect with all the elements and landing page templates is to help entrepreneurs and businesses to build a website that can convert more visitors into leads, clients, and customers.

And if your goal is to get engagement and more clients then Thrive Architect is the right tool for your business.

items.title: Thrive Themes Vs ClickFunnels: The Ultimate Review
items.summary: Introduction to Thrive Themes Vs ClickFunnelsIf you are aware of lead generations…
items.content_html:
Introduction to Thrive Themes Vs ClickFunnels

If you are aware of lead generations and lead capturing then you will surely hear about ClickFunnels and Thrive Themes.

ClickFunnels is a feature and most used sales funnel concept platform. It also offers various functions including customized funnel templates, membership, and split testing for landing pages.

And,

The Thrive Themes Membership is a complete suite of conversion-focused WordPress themes and plugins and its tools and plugins range from page builders and marketing timers to landing page templates with A/B Testing tools.

So, Simply we can say that ClickFunnels is basically used and designed for creating sales funnels to make your sales and marketing easy and Thrive Membership was the complete suite of marketing and sales which includes WordPress Plugins which make sure to run your marketing landing pages and marketing processes in an easy manner.

And comparing Thrive Membership with ClickFunnels is like comparing Fruits with Vegetables. Both are helpful in creating optimized and conversion-optimized funnels with A/B Testing capabilities.

Thrive themes is not advertised for funnel building solution but funnels you will create with ClickFunnels can also be created with Thrive Themes and its plugins. Both platforms differ in their features, functionality, and price.

So, let’s start the comparison by providing the meaning of the term ‘funnel’.

A funnel is a process of converting leads towards a goad. Funnels can be anything like a set of pages and structured sequences.

Pricing Comparison of Thrive Themes and ClickFunnels

Pricing of Thrive Membership

 

 

  • $19/ month
  • ($228/year)
  • Unlimited Unique Visitors
  • Unlimited Funnels
  • Unlimited Pages
  • Up to 25 different sites

Pricing of ClickFunnels (Basic)

 

 

  • $97/month
  • (​$1,164/year)

items.title: LeadPages Vs ClickFunnels: The Ultimate Review
items.summary: Are you looking for a review of Leadpages vs ClickFunnels? Not sure…
items.content_html:
Are you looking for a review of Leadpages vs ClickFunnels? Not sure whether to choose ClickFunnels or Leadpages?

Above are very hard questions but now you have come to the right place. In this review, we are taking a depth look at both of these marketing tools to help you which one is right for yours. In the world of marketing, there is no such thing as a “one size fits for all” tool. You can come into this review learning towards one but then you realize that the other one fits better.

We will look at both tools individually and then compare them together in a head to head match.

But before we discuss the tools let me explain the difference between a landing page and a funnel.

What is a Landing Page?

A landing page can be a page of your website that a new visitor lands first on that page. By definition, if we go then a landing page can be an email opt-in page, a sales page, your website’s homepage, a blog post, a product listing, or any other page on which you want to drive traffic.

In marketing, your goal is to create optimized landing pages for first-time visitors on your welcome page and help them to learn about your product or services. You may not make sales but you can collect email subscribers by offering lead forms or free ebooks or an email course.

What is Funnel?

The goal of your funnel may not be purchasing a product but it may be subscribing to your mailing list or signing up for a free trial. The ultimate goal is to make a sale but that is not mean that every funnel has to lead a sell.

You may also have several types of funnels on your site like:

  1. One that nurtures leads.
  2. One that upsells your customers.
  3. One that converts leads into your customers.

Sales funnels are just a series of conversion-optimized pages.

What is ClickFunnels?

ClickFunnels is a marketing software that can help you to create conversion-optimized pages to use in your sales funnels. ClickFunnels was developed by Russell Brunson who was an Internet marketer, the best selling author, and also the founder of DotCom Secrets.

How does it work?

ClickFunnels allows you to create sales funnels and landing pages both. You can also run an email marketing service, track and also manage affiliates and even you can operate a membership website with ClickFunnels.

For using ClickFunnels you don’t need to be a web designer or developer to create web pages. With its share funnels feature, you don’t even need to be a good marketer to create a successful sales funnel.

For details of every feature offered by ClickFunnels, you can read from our previous article.

Below are the features which make ClickFunnels such an outstanding marketing service.

Create Sales Funnels

Create a funnel for your goal using ClickFunnels. To do this you can select funnels from a library of pre-built funnels or create your own funnel from scratch.

Create a Landing Page

You can use this as a page editor to create your entire website if you would like. ClickFunnels can let you create landing pages up to 100 with the standard plan and up to 300 with the Elite plan.

Host your landing pages on ClickFunnels

You can host your landing pages on ClickFunnels without any issue with any plan you subscribed to.

Get a custom domain

You can register a new domain from ClickFunnel at an affordable cost.

Use ClickFunnels with WordPress

You can use ClickFunnels with WordPress by using ClickFunnels WordPress plugin with which you can easily integrate.

Share your funnels with others

You can share your funnels with others also with ClickFunnels sharing feature.

Nurture leads with the built-in email autoresponder

You can nurture your leads with the built-in email autoresponder without going to another email marketing tool software or service.

Perform split testing

With ClickFunnels, you can do split testing of various versions of your landing pages after creating variations of your landing pages with some changes.

ClickFunnels Integrations

Here is the list of all the integrations provided by ClickFunnels:

Email Integrations:

  • ActiveCampaign
  • AWeber
  • Constant Contact
  • ConvertKit
  • Drip
  • GetResponse
  • GVO Pure Leverage
  • HTML Form Integrations
  • HubSpot
  • Infusionsoft
  • Madmimi
  • MailChimp
  • Maropost
  • Ontraport
  • Salesforce
  • Sendlane
  • ZenPlanner

Payment Gateway Integrations:

  • Braintree
  • ClickBank
  • Deal Guardian
  • EasyPayDirect
  • InfusionSoft
  • JV Zoo
  • NMI
  • Ontraport
  • PayPal
  • Recurly
  • Stripe
  • Taxamo
  • Warrior Plus

ClickFunnels Support & Community

For supporting customers, ClickFunnels had done their job well. After signing up, you can start with six pre-built funnels.

And if you need any help, you can find a ton of resources in the help center. In the help center, you can find topics related to start creating with ClickFunnels to integrating third-party tools, everything in detail how you can do a start and creating funnels for your marketing.

And if you can’t find your answer in the help center articles then you can simply click the live chat to send a message to the support team and someone will get back to you within an hour. Also, you can reach ClickFunnels over Facebook also.

Pricing offered by ClickFunnels

The base plan starts with $97 per month in which you will get 14 days free trial to test all the features, and if you will pay for one year in advance you will get a free two-month subscription.

The second plan, known as Etison Elite, which is the full suite of services offered by ClickFunnels.

What is Leadpages?

Leadpages is a landing page builder with various marketing features for marketers. You can use this tool to create an optimized sales page from where you can collect and manage contacts for your marketing efforts.

Leadpages is more than just a landing page builder. With leadpages, you can use Leadboxes to create pop-up opt-in forms that can be placed on any page of your website. You can also generate leads via email with Leadlinks. Finally, Leaddigits allows you to get subscribers or contacts via text message also.

How does it work?

Leadpages is perfect for beginners who are just looking for a simple tool that is also budget-friendly. With the use of Leadpages, you will get a very intuitive experience. Even if you have never created landing pages before you will also feel confident using Leadpages on your first try.

Also, Leadpages works with all the major email service providers, so you can collect emails and continue to collect leads who have signed up through your landing page.

For details of every feature offered by Leadpages, you can read from our previous article.

With Leadpages you can create landing pages to offer products or services to your visitors who come first on a web page to deliver automatic digital assets with Leadpages.

Below are the features which make Leadpages such an outstanding landing page builder and marketing software.

Drag and Drop Customization

With Drag and drop customization in Leadpages, you can easily build your landing page from the pre-built template as well as from scratch. It is quite easier than doing with self or manual customization.

Pre-Built Landing pages

Leadpages also provides a number of pre-built landing page templates you just need to select the template you want to use and start the drag and drop customization in a very easy manner.

Split testing for your landing pages

With Leadpages you can do split testing for your landing pages and what you want to test about how much traffic you will get on that particular variant of the landing page.

Lead Notifications

If you have created a landing page but you have not connected any email marketing software then you don’t need to worry about your leads. You will get notified via your registered email id for your upcoming leads from your particular landing pages.

This is a great feature Leadpages comes with.

SMS Sign-ups

No one wants to see a lot of sign up forms for your lists. You should make it easy on them. Leadpages gives you the option to offer SMS sign up. With Leadpages you can send a text to their phone, they can respond to you with an email address. You will get this feature with LeadDigits which is one of the special features or addon by Leadpages.

Easy to use opt-in Pop-ups

As we all know about Pop-ups which are the proven method to capture leads. Use Leadboxes to create various types of opt-ins including your favorite pop-up or the exit intent. You can also use their WordPress plugin and embed these pop-ups on your blog posts outside the LeadPages.

LeadDigits

LeadDigits allows you to collect email leads through text message instead of asking people to visit on your website, just you need to ask them to text your LeadDigits number. Once they provide you their contact number they will get an automated text asking them to sign up to your email list. LeadDigits also offers an experience that will also improve your conversion rates. Because people will forget to look at your website.

Leadpages Integrations

Here is the list of all the integrations provided by Leadpages:

Email Integrations Supported by Leadpages

  • 1ShoppingCart
  • ActiveCampaign
  • AWeber
  • ConstantContact
  • Drip
  • Emma
  • GetResponse
  • GoToWebinar
  • Hubspot
  • iContact
  • InfusionSoft
  • Interspire
  • MadMimi
  • Marketo
  • MailChimp
  • OfficeAutoPilot
  • Salesforce
  • SendReach
  • WebinarJam

Leadpages Support & Community

Leadpages run various training webinars frequently with the aim of helping you to get more. Also, you can get more help from their active blogs, collection of marketing resources, and knowledge base. But they can’t provide chat on their site, chat feature is only available inside the Leadpage app for Pro and advanced members.

Pricing offered by Leadpages

Leadpages offered three-tiered pricing plans which are Standard, Pro, and advanced.

Also, you can choose a month to month billing for standard and Pro plan. The advanced plan requires an annual or two-year payment upfront. You will save quite a bit more if you will pay for annual and especially for a two-year service in which pricing is cut off in half as compared to monthly billing.

Standard Plan

In this plan, you have to pay $17 per month when you purchase two years upfront, $25 per month when you will purchase annually, and $37 for a month to month plan. Month to month is still in your budget if you will get such great features inside in comparison with ClickFunnels.

Pro Plan

In this plan, you need to pay $42 per month when you purchase for two years, $48 per month when you will purchase annually and $79 for a month to month plan.

Advanced Plan

This plan does not offer month to month plan. For annual billing you need to pay $199 per month and for two year purchase, you need to pay $159 per month.

ClickFunnels Vs. Leadpages

There a various factors that I personally believe most people will look at price and ease of use.

When you will see for price compatibility then Leadpages is the winner here. It is a bit cheaper than ClickFunnels.

There is a reason why Leadpages is much cheaper than ClickFunnels like Leadpages are not that much convenient than ClickFunnels.

You don’t need a separate web host or a seperate email marketing or shopping cart solution. Also you don’t need a seperate affiliate program. Everything is included in just one package.

If you are looking at this way then ClickFunnels is very budget friendly in its own right. But, I do think Leadpages is an awesome choice in some situations. If you want to create landing pages much quickly without more customization then Leadpages is a greap platform for you.

So, which should you choose?

Go with Leadpages if you want a budget marketing software that can get the job done. You can create beautiful sales pages without knowing a bit of codes.

Go with ClickFunnels if you want to create an effective conversion optimized funnel pages without learning HTML.

Go with Leadpages if you simply want to design landing pages with a simple one-step landing page.

Go with ClickFunnels if you don’t want to use different systems for marketing program. You will save much time with an all in one solution.

Go with ClickFunnels, if you want to create an funnel with multiple pages along with the flexibility to rearrange the pages in your funnel.

Conclusion

I love to use both ClickFunnels and Leadpages, and I think both are great tools for converting leads. You can only build pages on Leadpages but you can build pages and build funnels as well on ClickFunnels. The right choice for you will mainly depend on what you need from a marketing tool. But if you are still not confirmed about which one to use then you should try 14 days free trial of ClickFunnels and test all features. If you find that is not good for your business then cancel and check out Leadpages. I am about 90% sure that ClickFunnels will do everything you want.

Ease of Use Comparison of LeadPages Pro Vs Thrive Membership

All visual editors are much the same but this is where the smallest details or points in terms of usability becomes important. While you are building complex pages and websites which involve hundreds of user actions. If an editor is a few seconds slower on any step, then it can turn to frustrating hours.

Thrive Membership Ease of Use

If you are new to WordPress then you have various things to learn and build your online business and generate more leads.

When you will get to know everything about drag and drop editor, then it’s not just simple and fast to use but very powerful also and takes you to feel of designer level customization.

Thrive has a huge knowledge base of training content and also there are new features you can expect blog posts and various learning videos to explain its features and how to use them in a very easier manner.

LeadPages Pro Ease of Use

Standard templates or LeadPages Pro are designed for quick development only allows you to swap some key elements for your industry before publishing.

Hence, once you are ready to use it then you can use it with just some clicks on what you want to edit and then edit it.

Also, their drag-and-drop editor also much more useful than the standard template editor but is not very flexible means you can drag-and-drop elements on the landing page but when you want to move page sections requires drag-and-dropping from the sidebar menu then you need their draggable columns to create width layouts.

However, LeadPages also has an extensive knowledge base, and also you can choose from some great tutorials and webinars which teach you how to use their features and take advantage of the product.

User Support Comparison of LeadPages Pro and Thrive Membership

User Support in Thrive Membership

If you have purchased Thrive Membership then you will also get unlimited access to their support team till that time when you are a member. If you will purchase a single Thrive Product then you will get access to one year of unlimited support and if you will need help after that one year then you can also extend your support term with a small fee.

The support team is very fast and extremely knowledgeable. Just you need to do is log in to the support forum and post a ticket and you will get a response on the same day.

As my personal experience, there is a rare case they can’t solve your issue through the ticket then they can log in to your website if you want and fix it for you with security.

User Support in LeadPages Pro

When you have purchased a LeadPages membership, then your support level depends on your subscription plan. At the basic plan, you have access to the knowledge base, and also you can submit support tickets from your account dashboard.

At the Pro Level you will get access to personal support chat which is available for you from Monday to Friday from 9 am to 5 pm and also you can able to submit support tickets.

At the Expertise level, you can submit support tickets, use live chat, and also you can get live phone support which is available for Monday to Friday from 9 am to 5 pm CST.
